      Object getSynchronizationObject()
      If a driving adapter does not use invoke(Method, Object, Object[]) to call an
      Object invoke​(Method method, Object object, Object[] args)

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public Object invoke​(Method method,
                     Object object,
                     Object[] args)
              throws InvocationTargetException,
                     IllegalAccessException
        This method performs a synchronized method invocation on given method. Note: If this method is not used by a driving adapter it must use return value getSynchronizationObject() to synchronize method invocation on a port.
        Parameters:
        method - Method that should be called. Must not be null
        object - concrete instance of the object on which the method should be called
        args - attributes
        Returns:
        result of the method
        Throws:
        InvocationTargetException - forwards exception from Java's reflective API because it cannot be handled here in a meaningful way
        IllegalAccessException - forwards exception from Java's reflective API because it cannot be handled here in a meaningful way

      • getSynchronizationObject

        public Object getSynchronizationObject()
        If a driving adapter does not use invoke(Method, Object, Object[]) to call an
        Returns:
        Object that must be used in synchronized-block
